Mix together 1 tablespoon\n each of finely ground orange peel and ground almonds.This is slightly abrasive and very cleansing.\n Take roughly a teaspoon in the palm of your hand,mix with a little water and use the paste to scrub the skin then wash.

Soap your face well,adding a small handful of sugar to the lather. Massage this in for couple of minutes, then rinse off with warm water.This scrub is very useful for a spotty and sluggish looking skin

Mix sugar and rose water in a pan over a low heat.\n When it begins to caramel remove from the heat and add to it beaten yolk of an egg.Replace it on low heat for a minute and mix to it one teaspoon of lemon juice.This recipe is very useful for dry skins.
Add a handful of powdered milk to the bathwater
Use one tablespoon of oatmeal in bath.Oatmeal and bran contain oils and vegetable hormones which oothe and soften the skin.
Add a teaspoon of honey to your bath water.Relieves tiredness.
Mix a few tablespoons of laundry starch and a teaspoon of glycerine and add to bath water.It leaves your skin beautifully smooth,tight and soft
Lavender,hyssop,mint,borage,rosemary,balm or camomile are useful herbs which can be used in bath water either separately or in a mixture.
Add any oil that is almond,olive or sunflower to bath water. Baby oil or mineral oil is not suitable as it cannot be absorbed by the skin.
Mix together one Egg,\n 1/2 cup shampoo and 1 teaspoon gelatine with an electric beater.Add the mixture to bath water when the tap is running.

Mix the following in a jar and use a little quantity in bathwater:
 3 tablespoons Oatmeal flour,
 1tablespoon oatmeal bran,
 1 tablespoon Ground almonds,
 1 tablespoon Wheat flour,
 Perfume 5 to 6 drops.

Collect the following:
 Sugar-2 tablespoons,
 Water-2 tablespoons,
 Egg yolk-beaten-One,
 Lemon juice-1 teaspoon
 Put sugar and water in a pan,over a low heat.When it begins to caramelise,remove from the heat and add egg yolk. Replace it on the low heat for a minute and mix to it lemon juice.
 This is very ideal scrub for slightly dry skin or for a spotty and sluggish looking skin.
 To apply sugar scrub, soap your face well, adding a small handful of sugar to the lather. Massage for a couple of minutes, then rinse off with warm water.

Mix the following ingredients to make a paste and rub thoroughly to cleanse and stimulate the skin leaving it soft and shiny:
 Dried grounded and sieved lemon peel-1 tablespoon,
 Ground almond-1 tablespoon,
 Salt n ground allspice-a pinch of each,
 Wheatgerm flour-4 tablespoon,
 Ground thyme-1 tablespoon,
 Almond oil-sufficient to make paste,
 Jasmine Oil(to perfume)- Few drops
Rose water-3 tablespoons,\n Glycerine-1 tablespoon,\n Lime juice-2 tablespoons

Apply this body lotion after bath if you have a dry skin.The proportion of the lotion can be changed to suit the skin. This lotion does not feel sticky and mixes into your skin.Lotion can be stored in refrigerator.

Glycerine-1 teaspoon,
 Water-4 tablespoons,
 Soap flakes-3 tablespoons,
 Witch-hazel-1 teaspoon,
 Olive oil-4 teaspoons,
 Blue Colouring-few drops,
 Perfume-few drops

Put the soap flakes and water in a saucepan and heat.When soap flakes get dissolved remove from heat and add glycerine, olive oil and witch hazel.\n Stir until it cools and then add the blue colouring and some perfume.Applying this non-greasy body lotion after a bath leaves the skin glowing like satin.

Borax-1 teaspoon,
 Rose water-1 cup,
 Olive oil(warm)-2 tablespoons,
 Lavender water-1 cup

Lavender water is made by infusing a handful of lavender flowers in two cups of boiling water to make a concentrate of one cup.Now dissolve borax in rose water,then slowly add olive oil beating constantly.\n When all the oil had been added to the water and it forms an emulsion ,add lavender water.Let it stand for an hour and then strain and use.

Lanolin-3 teaspoons,
 Almond oil-1 teaspoon,
 Petroleum Jelly-1 teaspoon,
 Vegetale lard-1 teaspoon,
 Glycerine-2 teaspoon,
 Water-10 tablespoons,
 Soap flakes-1 teaspoon,
 Almond essence-few drops
Heat the oils and water separately. Remove them from heat and mix together.Pour the mixture into a bottle and shake vigorously then add to it the perfume.
Lanolin-4 tablespoons,\n Sunflower oil-4 tablespoons,\n Rose water-9 tablespoons
Heat the oils together and slowly add the heated water.Add a tablespoon of winter green or camphor oil.\n To make the cream lighter simply add two tablespoons of petroleum jelly.\n

Cleansing is the first step in caring for your skin. Perspiration, grease, dust, stale makeup, dirt must be completely removed.Cleansing cream is useful for removing stale make-up which has a waxy base.

Bees-wax-1/2 tablespoon,
 Emulsifying wax-1 tablespoon,
 Baby oil-4 tablespoons,
 Coconut oil-2 tablespoons, 
 Water-2 tablespoons,
 Borax-1/4 tablespoon,
 Witch hazel-1 tablespoon

Mix waxes and oil into an enamel bowl and melt slowly over a pan of boiling water.Heat the water and borax in a separate bowl till the borax is completely dissolved. Add witch-hazel. When the waxes are melted, remove both the bowls from the heat and mix in water stirring continuously.\n Beat until the mixture thickens and cools.

Bees wax-1.5 tablespoon,
 Emulsifying wax-1 tablespoon,
 Mineral oil-4 tablespoons,
 Rose water-6 tablespoons,
 Borax-1/2 teaspoon,
 Rose oil(perfume)-few drops

Melt water and oil together and at the same time, heat the water and borax and make sure that borax is completely dissolved.\n Remove both bowls from heat. Continue stirring until white cream begins to form. Add few drops of rose oil when mixture begins to cool. Carry on beating until mixture thickens

Bees wax-3 teaspoons,
 Coconut oil- teaspoons,
 Olive/Mineral oil-5 teaspoons,
 Cucumber juice-4 tablespoons,
 Glycerine-1 teaspoon,
 Borax-a pinch,
 Green colouring-1 drop

Melt oils and wax in the usual way over a plan of boiling water. Simultaneously, heat cucumber juice, glycerine, colouring and borax in a separate bowl. Dissolve borax completely. When the contents of both bowls are melted, add water drop by drop to the oil stirring continuously. Remove from heat and beat till the mixture thickens.\n Keep the cream in fridge as cucumber juice rots quickly. Make the cream in small quantity.

Lanolin-1/2 tablespoon,
 Petroleum jelly-1 tablespoon,
 Mineral oil-4 tablespoon,
 Water-10 tablespoons,
 Violet extract-5 drops

Melt two tablespoons vegetable lard and mix it to the mixture of two tablespoons corn oil and four tablespoons sunflower oil, stirring constantly. When cooled, mix few drops of perfume. Store this pale gold cream in refrigerator.\n\n
The drier your skin,the more lavish you should be in use of moisturiser.Moisturiser is applied after cleansing and toning,and always before applying make-up.
Almond Oil Moisturising Cream
Herb Cream
Avacado Almond Cream
Sunflower Cream
Jasmine Moisturising Cream
Nourishing Creams
Herbal Skin Tonics
Astringent Lotions
Prickly Heat
Face Mask
Teeth Cleansers
Mouth Wash
Cleansing Lotion
Patchy Baldness Remedies
Hair Conditioners
Hair Conditioners
Rub a piece of sandalwood on a clean stone,using a little rose water or cucumber juice to make a paste.This pack will help to relieve pimples and acne.
Slake lime in water and mix 2 tolas of finely powdered sulphur.The mixture should be boiled till about half is left.A light coat of fluid should be applied to the acne
Grind the seeds of Khurfa in milk and apply to the face.
Grind yellow sea shells(Kauris) and mix with butter and a small quantity f vinegar to make a paste.Apply the paste to affected parts of your face.
Apply cucumber juice mixed with rose water on the face.
Boil 50gms leaves of raspberry,strawberry or blackberry in 1 litre of water for 3 minutes.This makes a very pleasant and soothing wash for itching skin caused by pimples,acne or scabs.
Make a paste of 1 teaspoon pure sulphur powder, 2 tablespoons Fullers Earth and one egg white.Use this mask everyday to cure acne.
Mash and sieve onion.Mix onion juice into paste with one teaspoon Fullers earth and 1 teaspoon honey.This pack is good to prevent acne and blemishes.
Rub the spots with raw garlic, this will kill them instantly.
Melt 25gms of bees-wax on low heat.Add 100gms of honey to it.Stir until cool,then pot and seal tightly.\n Keep in a cool place.Apply to affected spots at night,then wash it off the next morning.

Mix the following ingredients together to make a thick paste.
 Wheatgerm-1 teaspoon,
 Clear honey-2 tablespoons,
 Sunflower oil-1 teaspoon,
 Fresh lemon juice- 1 teaspoon
 Apply it in small circular rubbing movements to the face and neck and leave for 5 minutes,then wash off with warm water.
Grind the bark of the Neem tree,mix it with a little water and apply the paste on the affected area.
Grind together bark of the castor tree and the root of Biskhapra and apply as a paste.
Avoid sour or fatty foods.\n
Among fruits,take melon as it helps cleanse the blood.
Take a leaf of Peepal tree,smear it with ghee and apply as a lukewarm bandage on the boil,which shall burst in its preliminary stage and subside.
Dissolve Fullers Earth in water to make a thin paste. It should be smeared over the affected parts. When the paste dries, wash it off with cold water
Apply green henna ground in water on the affected skin.
Grind leaves of Neem in water and apply on the affected skin.

Take a small piece of sandalwood and rub it to a paste on a stone with rose water.Mix it to a pinch of powdered alum and apply to the affected skin twice or thrice a week depending upon the condition of prickly heat.
Mix one teaspoon each of honey, fresh lemon juice/orange juice and cod liver oil. Take three times a day.
Pulp the comfrey leaves with honey and garlic and apply.
Rub half a lemon on the affected skin.
Apply a poultice of crushed fenugreek seeds boiled in water for ten minutes.
Crush one handful of fresh linseeds and add to it boiling water to make a paste. Apply thickly and cover.
Soak a slice of bread in boiling water. Add one teaspoon of mustard powder in the water. Apply this bread poultice on affected parts.
Apply extract of calendula flower on the affected skin.
Grate a raw carrot into 1 tablespoon of wheat germ oil. Apply as a thick poultice and leave over.
Mix the powdered bark of slippery elm with eucalyptus oil to make a thick soothing poultice. Effective for boils, pustules.\n

Melt bees-wax,emulsifying wax, almond oil, lanolin and coconut oil on medium heat and stir it. Now add orange flower water gradually to it, but keep on stirring. When the mixture becomes thick, remove it from the heat and when cold fill in a bottle. Cover your skin when going out with this lotion.
Melt lanolin, petroleum jelly and mineral oil on a medium heat. Heat clean water and violet extract in another bowl and mix the contents of the two containers and stir till it cools.
Freckles are brownish spots on the skin due to precipitation of pigments or exposure to sun. When skin is sensitive to UV rays,freckles appear on it.\n
Grind in milk yellow mustard seeds and apply to the face at night. Wash your face next morning.
Mix equal quantity of turmeric and sesame seeds. Add water, grind to a paste and apply to the face.
Take a watermelon. Make a hole in its rind and introduce some grains of rice in it. Take out the rice after a week, grind to a paste and apply on the face.

Mix 4 teaspoons of sour milk with one teaspoon of ground oatmeal and 1 teaspoon of freshly grated horse-radish. Apply the paste to the freckles, taking care to avoid eyes as the fumes can cause stinging. Leave the paste on the affected area for 30 minutes, then wash off.
Grind pumpkin seeds and mix with olive oil to make a paste and apply. This keeps the skin soft and fair and reduces freckles.
Raspberry mask clears blemishes due to freckles. Mix 25 gms of mashed raspberries with one teaspoon each of plain yoghurt and finely ground oatmeal. Leave on the face for 10 minutes.\n

Facial massage is an effective way to counter wrinkles.Massage is a slow process and its results are obvious only when it is continued for a longer period. Massage is effective if the skin is clean.\n Facial massage reduces unattractive fleshiness, tightens the tissue of the muscles and increases blood circulation.\n If the skin is dry, use a good moisturiser before massage. If the skin is damp, it is advisable to use some astringent lotion before massage.
Egg and Yeast Mask
Mix together egg yolk, 1 tablespoon Brewers yeast and 1 teaspoon sunflower oil into a paste and apply. Leave it on for 15 minutes. Rinse it off with milk. This pack is good for spotty skin.
Lecithin Mask
Mix together 1 tablespoon lecithin, 2 teaspoons peach(or any fruit) juice and 1 teaspoon wheat-germ oil into a paste and apply.
Almond Mask
Mix together 2 teaspoons ground almonds, 1 teaspoon rose water and 1/2 teaspoon honey into a paste and apply on the face. Leave it for 15 minutes and rinse off with rose water.
Apple Mask

Blend 1/2 peeled and sliced apple, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 teaspoon ascorbic acid, 1 egg yolk, 1 tablespoon Cider Vinegar and 3 tablespoons oil until completely smooth. Apply on the face and leave for 30 minutes, then rinse off. This is effective way for all skins.
Avocado Mask
Avocado is rich in oil. It can be used to soothe and smooth dry skin.\n Mash a ripe avocado with one teaspoonful of lemon juice and white of an egg. Leave it on the face for 20 minutes and wash.
Butter Milk Mask
Mix 1 or 2 tablespoons oatmeal with enough butter milk and apply this on the face. Leave it for 15 minutes, then rinse off.
Honey Mask

Honey is excellent for smoothing the skin and softening lines. Spread it as a film all over the face. Leave for 15 minutes and remove with cottonwool pads and warm water.
 For dry skins, Mix to a paste 1/2 teaspoon honey, 1 egg yolk, 1 tablespoon dry skimmed milk and apply to the face and neck. Leave it for 20 minutes, then rinse off with tepid water.
 For oily skins, mix 1/2 teaspoon honey with a dessertspoonful of lemon juice. Mix to a paste with Fullers Earth(Multani mitti),adding water.

If you cannot afford the regular saloon treatments, then best thing is to give yourself a homefacial. A regular facial once a fortnight is a good habit which will ensure a youthful and fresh skin for a long time.\n
Tie your hair away from the face and neck or wear a bandeau.
Cleanse your face and neck with cleansing milk and wipe off, first with a facial tissue and then with a wet towel.
Apply cream in dots all over the face and blend it thoroughly then massage your face and neck in upward direction.
Prepare a face-pack suited to your skin type and apply on the face.
When it is dry, wash your face and neck with cold water, keeping your eyes closed. Dry your skin and apply skin tonic.
If you have an important date, use skin tonic after facial, then apply moisturiser and make-up.\n

For normal skin: Mix 2 tablespoons of gram flour and 4 tablespoons of milk in a clean container. Apply all over the face and neck leaving area around the eyes and lips.Leave it on for ten minutes and wash off.
For oily skin: Mix 2 tablespoons honey with 1 teaspoon lemon juice and 1 teaspoon rose water. Apply all over the face and leave for five minutes then wash off.
For dry skin: Mix 1 tablespoon milk powder with 1 teaspoon gram flour and 2 tablespoons rose water. Leave it on for 15 or 20 minutes, then rinse off.
For very dry skin: Mix together the yolk of an egg, a teaspoon of almond oil, a teaspoon of milk cream and apply for 10 to 15 minutes, then wash off.
For tanned skin: Grind ten almonds to a paste and mix to a teaspoon of curd. Use this pack to remove tan and soften skin.
For dull skin: Mix Fullers Earth,brewers yeast and rose water to form 2 tablespoons of paste. Apply for 15 minutes.It nourishes the skin.
For pimply skin: Rub a piece of sandalwood on a clean stone using a little rose water or cucumber juice. Apply the paste thus formed. This pack gives a tingling fresh feeling too.
For blemished skin: Add cucumber juice to any of these powders such as gram flour, kaolin, Fullers Earth and milk powder to form a paste. This will also tighten the skin pores.\n
Bees wax grated-2 teaspoons,\n Coconut oil-2 teaspoons,\n Castor oil-1 teaspoon
Melt the bees-wax and coconut oil together in a bowl and add castor oil and stir well. Remove from heat. Pour in small jars.Very useful for sore and chapped lips.
Lip Gloss
Put 1/2 teaspoon of grated bees-wax in a small basin with 2 tablespoons of cocoa butter. Place the basin in a saucepan containing a little water and heat until the wax melts,stirring well.
Lip Protective Cream

Melt 2 teaspoons bees-wax in a small bowl.Mix to it 4 teaspoons almond oil and beat. Remove from heat and stir in warm rose water./n Stir until the mixture cools and thickens. Bottle while still warm. This is an excellent everyday protective Cream.\n
Smile is an important asset.Brush teeth thoroughly atleast twice a day. Clean your teeth before going to bed.
Teeth Cleansers
Mouth Wash
Cleansing Lotion
Mix 3 tablespoons bicarbonate of soda with 2 tablespoons salt and use as a tooth powder. To make recipe more effective, add pulverised orange/lemon peel to the mixture to whiten the teeth.
Mix the ashes of burnt bread, charcoal, burnt rosemary, honey, salt and barley/millet. Very effective to clean the teeth.
Rub strawberries over the teeth,this will clean the teeth.

Vinegar-1/4 cup,
 Wine-1/2 cup,
 Honey-1/2 cup,
 Powdered cloves-1 teaspoon
Take the following ingredients, boil them together and use as mouth wash when it cools:
Stir 3 drops of essential oil of lavender into 1 teaspoon of clear honey and add to it 1/4 cup of boiling water,then dilute with cold water to make a warm solution.
Mix two teaspoons of sea salt and two teaspoons hydrogen peroxide in a large glass of warm water.Rinse your mouth.\n This is an effective recipe to keep teeth sparkling.

Bright eyes indicate good health and vitality. Sleep is vital for bright,shining eyes. Lack of sleep can make the eyes look red and puffy.\n Skin around the eyes is very sensitive.With fingers,slowly massage the area around the eyes with an eye cream.

Lanolin-1 tablespoon,
 Almond oil-1.5 tablespoon,
 Powdered lecithin-1 teaspoon,
 Cold water-2 tablespoons

Melt lanolin in a pan held over boiling water and add almond oil to it. Remove from heat and slowly add the powdered lecithin. Now add to it cold water, drop by drop. Mix it all together with a wooden spoon. Do not use perfume, as this may cause allergy.

Grate half cucumber, strain it and keep in the refrigerator to cool. Mix to it an equal quantity of rosewater. Take a piece of cotton wool dipped in the lotion and place on your eyes atleast twice a day. Apart from relaxing eyes, this will also help to lighten the darkened area around the eyes.
Dip cotton wool in the solution of witch-hazel and use as eye pads. This is very effective for reducing puffiness of eyes.
Almond, apricot and coconut oils are good for lubricating delicate skin around eyes. Frequent gentle massage will help to arrest and disperse the lines.
The juice from freshly crushed mint leaves will help eradicate dark shadows beneath the eyes.

Mix 1 tablespoon of castor oil with 2 tablespoons of almond oil to make an excellent eye make-up remover. A drop of perfectly fresh castor oil smeared along the lids will reduce flaky swelling, irritation and puffiness of eyes.

Grated raw potato can be used to ease sore puffy eyelids and reduce under-eye puffiness. Either strain the juice from a grated potato and saturate cotton wool pads with it or lay the grated vegetable on the eye between layers of muslin. Slices of raw potato or compress of 1 tablespoon of crushed nasturtium seeds added to 1 tablespoon of grated potato will soothe swollen eyelids and reduce swelling.

Add 1 tablespoon of marigold petals in 125 ml of boiling water. Strain the liquid then simmer one peeled and finely chopped apple in it. When it is soft, drain the apple, allow it to cool and when of a comfortable temperature lay it between two layers of gauze. Place on the eyes and leave for ten minutes.
Apple juice which is smooth, silky and rich in pectin can also be used to wipe sore eyes and keep eyes sparkling. Always extract juice from freshly cooked apples.
Dandruff is one of the major disorders of scalp. The uppermost layer of the scalp is being continuously shed off called as dandruff. Dandruff if neglected for a long time, leads to baldness.
Dandruff Remedies
Hot Oil Therapy
Massage hot oil into the scalp at bedtime. Next morning, rub lemon juice mixed with cosmetic vinegar (mix 1:2 ratio) into the scalp before an hour.

Give the hair a good wash with egg shampoo.\n Egg shampoo is one of the oldest beauty recipes.Eggs are full of proteins. Beat up 1 or 2 eggs with a cup of water and massage thoroughly into your wet hair and leave it on for 5-10 minutes. Rinse off thoroughly and do not use hot water for rinsing.

Another method is to beat 1 egg in a cup of water and mix it to 1 or 2 tablespoons of shampoo. As a last rinse, use the juice of one lemon in a cup of hot water. Continue this treatment once a week for three months.
Stroking the Hair

Give hair a hundred strokes every night with brush or comb. Remember that root of each hair is the sebaceous gland that ooze oil to keep the hair soft and gleaming. Take the brush from root of hair to very end of the hair so that oil is carried to each hairtip.\n Hair should be brushed or combed gently or lightly when wet as there is a danger of being stretched or weakened.
Hair Nourishing Recipe
Boil 5 teaspoons of dried used tea leaves in lime water and use it as the last rinse after shampoo, giviing the hair a shine.
Anti-dandruff Lotion

Mix 2 tablespoons of cosmetic vinegar and 6 tablespoons of hot water. Dab with cotton wool into scalp, parting hair with a comb at bedtime. Next morning wash the hair with shampoo.After the hair is cleansed, pour over as last rinse a mixture of 3 tablespoons of cosmetic vinegar and 1 cup of hot water. Do this twice a week for 3 months.
Apple Juice Tonic
Mix together 1 tablespoon of pure apple juice and 3 tablespoons warm water and massage into the scalp, three times a week. This recipe helps to fight dandruff.
Rosemary and Borax Lotion
Mix 5 tablespoons of strong rosemary infusion with a pinch of borax and massage into the scalp daily.
Nasturtium Tea
Mix 1 drop of essential oil thyme with nasturtium tea to make a strong infusion. It should be used to rinse the hair or massage the scalp to cure dandruff.\n

Hair reflects ones general health. Tension, overwork and illness can effect your hair.\n Breaking hair or split ends has usually been badly treated due to over-exposure to sun, over-perming, amateur bleaching, frequent and inexpert use of tints, colourants.\n A good hair conditioner helps these problems.
Quick Hair Conditioner

Mix together 1 egg, 2 tablespoons castor oil, 1 teaspoon vinegar and 1 teaspoon glycerine. Beat constantly and massage into the scalp. Wrap your head in a hot towel and steam the hair, then wash off. This conditioner will make your hair look thicker, shiny, soft and manageable.
Honey Conditioner
Beat up one egg and mix 1 teaspoon honey and 2 teaspoons coconut or olive oil. Massage it well into the scalp. Steam the hair and then shampoo. This leaves the hair easy to manage and looking lovely.
Alcoholic Conditioner
Beat up one egg and 2 tablespoons brandy. Massage into the scalp. Leave for 10 minutes and rinse off. The egg nourishes and the brandy stimulates the hair.
Gypsy Conditioner

Steep a medium-sized onion. Cut into slices in half a cup of rum. Leave for 24 hours. Remove the onions and use remaining liquid for massaging scalp. This is an effective liquid for those afflicted with dandruff and losing hair.
Powerful Hair Tonic

Chop 100 gms each nettle leaves and nasturtium flowers, 50 gms each nasturtium seeds and leaves. Put them in a glass jar with 600ml rum, keep for three weeks, strain, extract all the liquid and store. Massage frequently into the scalp to condition the hair,preferably at night.
Home-made Brilliantine
Melt in a bowl over hot water 50 gms white wax, then beat in 400ml olive oil followed by 4 drops each bergamot and clove oil and 2 drops geranium oil. Remove from heat, allow to cool and store.\n

The sudden appearance of small bald circles on the scalp is patchy baldness. It is alarming when the patches grow and join up. Premature baldness is generally hereditary. But it takes months for the full growth.
Preserve mangoes in oil for a period of one year and rub this oil on the scalp.
Grind 2 or 3 cloves of garlic together with a pinch of colloyrium and applied to the hairless patch. In case of irritation, smear butter over the patch.
Dissolve a few grains of potassium permanganate in a few drops of water, and apply to the bald patches a few times a day. Continue for a minimum for three weeks.
Grind tender leaves of Caper Berry into paste and apply these on the bald patches.
Wash the bald patch with juice of Amla. Rub finely powdered Salmiac mixed with butter on it.

Put some curdled milk in a copper vessel. The vessel should be without tin coating.Mix to it stave made of Neem wood.With repeated churnings, the curdled milk turns green. It should be applied to the hairless patches for a few days.
Grind 50 gms leaves of Tamarish and make into pellets. Burn in boiling mustard oil, then massage on the bald patches.\n

Most of the young men and women are afflicted with premature greying of hair and are left out with option of hair dyeing. Grey hair should not be pulled, as it creates more grey hair near. Clip them off with scissors near the root.\n
Take Giloya and Gokhroo in equal parts and mix with honey. One teaspoon should be taken thrice a day.
Grind to a two parts Bhringaraja powder, one part Black Sesame seeds and one part Amla. Take one teaspoonful of powder with milk and sugar twice daily for 4 to 6 weeks.

Grind to a paste equal quantity of old Mandur, Amla and Hibiscus flowers. The paste should be applied on the head. When dry,the hair should be washed with water, in which Amla has been soaked overnight.

Grind 2 parts Amla, 2 parts Harad & Mandur into fine powder. A spoonful of powder should be wetted with water.Keep the paste in iron vessel overnight and apply to the hair next morning. When the paste is dry, apply oil to the hair, then the paste should be washed off thoroughly with cold water.
Rinse hair with saffron, ginger root, marigold or red oak bark. Use red henna to dye the hair.
Rinse hair with rosemary, sage or walnut leaves and shell.\n
Grey Hair Remedies

Hair dyeing is an art and has to be performed with care. Using it skillfully make the hair looks attractive and natural. Herbal dyes are not permanent. Herbs used for dyeing are henna, walnut bark, tea-leaves.
Precautions
Herbal Hair Dyes
Chemical Hair Dyes
Wash your hair clean, remove all grease.
Apply the dye as per instructions with a brush.
Dye leaves a black colour on fingers and nails which may mar the beauty of hands. So use rubber gloves.
Do not apply the dye on the skin of your scalp. Apply on hair only.
Let the dye remain on your hair for about an hour, wash it off with shampoo.

Chemicals used in dyes sometimes cause reaction on the skin. May cause a burning sensation. Reddishness starts with ears, spreads to eyes and face and may begin to swell.\n Hence it is advisable to take a skin test by applying a small quantity of dye on neck or elbow skin where the skin is sensitive.
If there is no reaction, go ahead. In case of reaction, Consult doctor immediately.\n

Grind dried henna leaves to a powder. Add water to make a paste. Apply paste to the hair, let it dry and then wash off with cold water.\n Henna is to be used twice during one application as it does not give colour in one attempt.
Soak walnut bark in water for 12 hours, then strain it and add few drops of ammonia.
Tea leaves are boiled in water till it leaves it colour. Let it cool. Apply on hair. This is not a permanent hair dye and is not so popular.\n

Shampoo removes hair dirt and all the secretions of sebaceous glands which accumulate on the scalp. For dry hair, choose a shampoo with cod-liver oil or lecithin as its base.\n If you have oily hair, a shampoo containing sulphur or essence of cedar is best.
Shampoos
Panama Wood Shampoo
Boil 50 gms of Panama wood in 2 pints of water.Let it soak for an hour. Strain off the liquid and use. This is a good preparation for normal and oily hair.
Egg Shampoo
This is one of the oldest beauty recipes. Eggs are full of protein. Beat two egg yolks in a glass of hot water. Strain, soak hair and scalp. Keep this on for an hour, then rinse off with water.
Rum Shampoo

Combine 2 egg yolks with 2 tablespoons of odourless linseed oil and 2 tablespoons of rum. Soak the hair and scalp. Keep it on for an hour, then rinse off with warm water. This is especially good for dandruff and dry hair.
Conditioning Shampoo

Mix together 1-2 tablespoons shampoo, 1 egg and 1 tablespoon unflavoured gelatine powder. Beat slowly in order to avoid lumps. Effective conditioning shampoo as egg and gelatine are both proteins and make hair lovely & thick.
Tonic Shampoo
Put 130 gms each dried reetha,shikakai and amla into 1 litre water. Keep it for 24 hours. Boil, allow to cool, strain and use as a shampoo.
Herb Shampoo

Wash 200 gms of dried olives and shikakai beans in cold water. Soak overnight in an iron pot, keep for 10 to 12 hours, boil in the morning for 10-15 minutes and strain. Liquidize the pulp that remains and use the paste to wash your hair. This shampoo leaves your hair soft and shiny.
Camomile & Soapwort

Take 1 tablespoon dried camomile, soapwort root powder in approximate quantity, 275ml boiling water. Soak the herbs in water overnight, then strain before use. Soapwort makes a soapy liquid which whilst it does not lather will fully cleanse the hair. Camomile will strengthen weak hair but other herbs may be used to meet specific problems.\n
Hair Setting Lotion
Lemon juice

Squeeze a lemon and use the strained juice for setting the hair.It makes the hair softy and shiny.Lemon juice dries very fast & can be used as an effective hair lacquer. To make a lemon hair lacquer, cut the lemon into pieces and boil it with a cup of water until it shrinks to only half a cup.Strain and use.A few drops of alcohol/vodka may be added to preserve it.
Gelatine, a protein agent is excellent as a setting lotion,giving body to limp hair. Dissolve 2 tablespoons gelatine in 2 cups of boiling water, and use it as a final rinse.
Add 1 tablespoon sugar to a glass of boiling water and when it has dissolved use it as a setting lotion by putting it into a spray bottle.
Wood shavings are soaked in water overnight and the translucent sticky fluid rising to the water surface can be well used as lacquer.It should be applied with a brush.

Crush the gum tragacanth with a pestle and mortar.Now add water to it and stir until the gum dissolves and you have a smooth solution. Now add alcohol and glycerine. After a couple of hours,the lotion will thicken.
Brilliantine

Melt together in a bowl over pan of hot water 1 tablespoon each castor oil, coconut oil, petroleum jelly (vaseline) & emulsifying wax. Remove from heat and add perfume,beating till you have made brilliantine. To make preparation more useful, you can add 2 teaspoons of lanolin to the mixture while melting. When removed from heat, just mix 1 teaspoon of water.This brilliantine holds unruley hair.\n

Heat 250 ml of mustard oil to a boiling point and burn it 21 leaves of Swallow Wort one by one. When the oil has cooled mix it to finely ground Mansal. The oil should be used to massage the affected parts.
Rub the affected parts with juice of lemon and jasmine. The itching surface is cured with regular massage.
Grind 20 gms of poppy seeds in water. Add to it 2 teaspoons of lime juice. The massage of this paste is good for dry itch.
Grind 10 gms of Yellow Thistle and mix in water.Strain and drink the liquid for a week. This relieves the worst type of itch.
Mix juice of 80 gms green leaves of Shahtara with 1 tablespoon of honey. This mix relieves itch due to scabies.
Ground 10 gms leaf shoots of Neem with seven grains of pepper. Mix in water. Strain and drink.
Boil 50 gms of leaves of Oleander(Kaner) in 250 ml of mustard oil till charred. The oil should be used for anointing the parts affected by itch.\n
Boil 20 gms of bark of Mango and Acacia trees in about one litre of water. Allow the vapours to play upon the affected part. After this fomentation,they should be anointed with ghee.
Powder Babchi seeds and mix with mustard oil. Apply to the affected area like an ointment.
The leaves of the Indian Butter tree(Mahua) should be smeared with sesame oil and heated over fire and bandaged on the affected parts. Change the bandage every 3 to 4 hours.
Drink the tea of Nettle or Dandelion(plant) or eat the Nettles in a nourishing soap. Dandelion leaves can be added in the salad. This cures eczema.
Place 25 gms of daisies on 1 litre of water and bring gently to boil. Boil for 2 minutes, then remove from the heat and let it stand for 10 minutes. Drink 3 cups a day between meals.
Simmer 50 gms of Birch leaves in 1 litre of water for 3 minutes. Leave until hot, then add a pinch of soda bicarbonate. Allow to cool for hours, then use a disinfectant wash.\n
A diet of raw foods is recommended including whey milk for breakfast and slippery elm and honey at night.

Boil 4 marigold heads in 4 cups of water for two minutes. Allow to cool, then massage the lotion well into the scalp. Wash hair with a very mild shampoo or a solution of soapwort. Add lemon juice or cider vinegar to the rinsing water to ensure a thorough rinse.

Dried burdock seeds-25 gms,
 Camomile flowers-2 to 3,
 Water-600 ml,
 Honey-1 tablespoon

Simmer burdock seeds and camomile flowers in water in a covered pan for 15 minutes. Strain through a clean cloth and sweeten to taste with honey. Keep in refrigerator. Take 3 tablespoons four times daily for 2 weeks.

Bees-wax-2 teaspoons,
 Emulsifying wax-1 teaspoon,
 Almond oil-5 teaspoons,
 Lavender oil-few drops

Melt both bees-wax and emulsifying wax in a bowl over water. When melted, mix almond oil to it. In another bowl,heat water over the same water so that the two bowls are at the same temperature.\n Slowly add water to the melted waxes and oils, stirring all the time. Remove mixture from the heat and continue stirring.\n When cool, add few drops of lavender oil.

Lanolin-1 tablespoon,
 Emulsifying wax-2 teaspoons,
 Beeswax-6 tablespoons,
 Almond oil-6 tablespoons

Put the oil and waxes together in a small container. Place the container in a bigger one with hot water and keep till the wax melts. Cool and store in a refrigerator.\n Take a couple of teaspoons of this cream, melt it and add a teaspoon of any herb lotion or infusion.

Beeswax-3 teaspoons,
Emulsifying wax-3 teaspoons,
 Almond oil-1/2 cup,
 Avocado oil-1/4 cup,
 Rose water-3 tablespoons

Melt waxes in an enamel pan over a water bath, then add the avocado and almond oils. Now add the heated rose water drop by drop, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and continue stirring till it cools. Now add few drops of perfume.\n Almond and Avocado are rich for the skin.

Lanolin-4 teaspoons,
 Emulsfying wax-2 teaspoons,
 Beeswax-2 teaspoons,
 Sunflower oil-5 tablespoons, 
 Water-6 tablespoons,
 Glycerine-2 teaspoons,
 Borax-1/2 teaspoon

Melt waxes, oil and lanolin over a water bath. Separately heat water, glycerine and borax making sure the borax is completely dissolved. While the melted oils and waxes are still on the heat, slowly add water to it drop by drop and continue beating with a wooden spoon till you get a whitish, thick & creamy textured rich cream.\n It leaves the skin looking moist and soft.

Emulsifying wax-2 tablespoons,
 Almond/Sunflower oil-2 tablespoons,
 Lanolin-1 teaspoon,
 Borax- 1/2 teaspoon,
 Witch-hazel-1 teaspoon,
 Glycerine-1.5 teaspoons,
 Water-8 tablespoons,
 Jasmine oil-few drops

Melt waxes, oil and lanolin together over a water bath. In a separate bowl heat water, glycerine and borax. Make sure the borax is completely dissolved. \n Then add witch-hazel. Now slowly add water to the oils, stirring constantly until it cools.Then add few drops of jasmine oil.\n The non-greasy cream thus formed is suitable for normal and greasy skins.

Nourishing preparations include all the skin foods whether they are oil-based or the moisturising type, whether they are light and immediately absorbed or heavy & sticky, needing to be massaged into the skin.
Cocoa Butter Cream

Cocoa Butter-2 tablespoons,
 Emulsifying wax-2 tablespoons,
 Beeswax-1 tablespoon,
 Sesame oil-4 tablespoons,
 Almond oil-1 tablespoon
When the ingredients are completely melted, remove from the heat and stir until the cream is cool, adding few drops of perfume. This cream leaves the skin smooth without being greasy.
Lanolin Cream
Mix 2 tablespoons lanolin with 8 tablespoons almond oil over a water bath. Good for dry skins and for elbows, knees , feet and neck.
Elder Flower Cream
Almond oil-3 tablespoons,\n Elder flowers blossoms-4 tablespoons,\n Lanolin-2 tablespoons
Mix together all the above ingredients in a bowl over a water bath. Let it simmer together for an hour, strain and then add warm water slowly, stirring.
Honey Cream

Honey is very useful for a dry, coarse and sensitive skin. Mix 3 tablespoons lanolin, 1/2 tablespoon honey and 1 teaspoon lecithin in a bowl and melt over a water bath. Now slowly add 4 tablespoons warm water to it, beating continuously until it cools.
Vitamin Cream

Bees-wax - 1 tablespoon,
 Emulsifying wax-1 tablespoon,
 Lanolin-1 tablespoon,
 Wheat-germ oil or Vitamin E - 2 capsules,
 Carrot oil or Vitamin A - 3 tablespoons,
 Distilled water-6 tablespoons,
 Borax-1/2 tablespoon,
 Tincture of benzoin-2 drops,
 Orange flower oil-few drops

Melt waxes and oils over a water bath. In a separate bowl, dissolve borax in warm water. Add water to the oils and beat until it cools. Add tincture of benzoin and continue beating until you get a thick moisturising cream. When mixing vitamin capsules, simply prick open the capsules and add contents to the mixture.
Wheat-germ Cream

Beeswax-1 teaspoon,
 Emulsifying wax-1 teaspoon,
 Lanolin-5 tablespoons,
 Sesame oil-3 tablespoons,
 Wheat-germ oil - 2 tablespoons,
 Water-5 tablespoons,
 Witch-hazel-1 tablespoon,
 Witch-hazel - 1 tablespoon,
 Borax-1/2 teaspoon, 
 Perfume-few drops

Melt waxes and oil over a water bath. Heat water and borax and make sure that the borax has completely dissolved. Now slowly add water to the melted oils and waxes. Stir until a thick, glossy nourishing cream is ready. Lanolin and wheat-germ oil contain Vitamin E.
Vegetable Cream

Beeswax-2 tablespoons,
 Emulsifying wax-4 tablespoons,
 Lanolin-3 teaspoons,
 Almond oil-4 tablespoons,
 Sesame oil-4 tablespoons,
 Avocado oil-2 tablespoons,
 Safflower oil-2 tablespoons,
 Sunflower oil-2 tablespoons,
 Water-5 tablespoons,
 Borax-1/2 teaspoons,
 Amber oil-few drops
Mix and melt the waxes and oils together over a water bath. In separate bowl, dissolve borax in warm water. Add water to the oils and beat until the cream cools. It gives the skin a satiny sheen.
Strawberry Cream

Mix 250 gms strawberries and 100 gms sugar in a pan and bring to boil. Cool and boil again. Allow strawberry juice to cool & store in the refrigerator. This lotion is very useful for oily skins.\n Melt 2 tablespoons each of lanolin and sunflower oil together over a water bath and mix it to strawberry juice. Remove from heat & stir thoroughly till it thickens to a creamy consistency.
Oily Nourishing Cream

Coconut oil-3 tablespoons,
 Olive oil-2 tablespoons,
 Almond oil-1 tablespoon,
 Beeswax-1/2 tablespoon
Dissolve 1/2 teaspoon borax in 3 tablespoons of heated water and mix it to melted oils slowly, stirring until a cool cream is ready.\n

Skin Toning is always done after cleansing routine with a mild skin freshener or with a medium strength skin tonic. Toning removes greasiness remaining from cleansing, closed pores, refines the skin. The most easiest toner is simply to splash cold water on face.\n Apply tonic with a piece of cotton wool. Toning stimulates the blood supply to the skin.\n
Rose Water

It is one of the oldest skin fresheners. Very easy to make on your own. Mix rose essence in pure water and shake thoroughly. Two tablespoons essence of roses is sufficient for 4 litres purified water.
Gypsy Rose Water
Put 2 handfuls of dark, scented rose petals into a jar containing 1 litre water & 200 gms of sugar. Keep the mixture for 2 hours. Shake thoroughly, strain and store in a cool place.
Rosewater & Witch-hazel tonic
Mix 1 cup of rosewater and 1/4 cup witch-hazel. For greasy skin, mix equal proportion of rosewater and witch-hazel.
Flower & Herb tonic
Mix 2 tablespoons of dried herbs or flowers to a pint of boiling water and cover the pan to prevent steam from being lost. Let the herbs steep for a couple of hours. Strain and bottle.
Marigold Skin tonic

Marigolds are knnown for healing properties. Mix 2 dried or 3 fresh marigold flowers to a pint of water and keep for 10 to 12 hours. Mix it to 2 tablespoons of witch-hazel. This is especially for greasy, spotty skins.
Hollyhock Skin tonic

Put 3 tablespoons of hollyhock leaves into a hald pint of boiling water. Cover and simmer gently for 5 minutes. Leave for half an hour, then strain and it is ready to use.\n Other flowers and leaves such as lilac, geranium, honey-suckle, lime flowers, lavender and landelions
Elder Flower tonic
Wash a handful of elder flower and mix it to 6 tablespoons of boiling water in a large jar.Steep them overnight. Strain next morning.
Vinegar Skin tonic

Cider vinegar-1/2 cup,
 Cloves-1/2 teaspoon,
 Lavender-1 tablespoon,
 Rose petals-1 tablespoon,
 Rosemary-1 tablespoon,
 Rose/orange flower water-2 tablespoons
Mix the ingredients and leave for seven days, shaking the bottle twice daily. Always use vinegar diluted in the ratio one part to eight parts of water.
Cucumber tonic

Wash & liquidise half-peeled cucumber. Put the juice in a saucepan, bring it to boil and simmer it for five minutes. Cool and strain it. Add 1 tablespoon of witch-hazel to every 2 tablespoons of cooked cucumber juice. Store the juice in a refrigerator. Mint can also be used in it. Add 4 tablespoons mint in the cucumber tonic.
Orange & Lemon tonic

Put one slice of orange, half lemon and 2 tablespoons of castor sugar into a pan with a cup of milk. Heat the mixture to near boiling point. When it is cool, it is ready for use. Store the tonic in a refrigerator.
Apple Tree Bark Tonic
Infuse 4 tablespoons of apple tree bark in 2 cups of boiling water. Add about 1 tablespoon of sage and apply to the face. \n
